titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, International Division, South and Southeast Asia, Karachi and Islamabad, Pakistan, Field Office Files
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, International Division, South and Southeast Asia, Karachi and Islamabad, Pakistan, Field Office Files FA647

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-10-17 20:40:46 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, International Division, South and Southeast Asia, Karachi and Islamabad, Pakistan, Field Office Files

physdesc.extent: 19 boxes -- 2 document boxes, 17 cubic foot boxes

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Level 1 Minimal Processing has been conducted to establish basic intellectual and physical control of the material and assess immediate preservation and conservation needs. Material remains as received, in original folders and storage boxes.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in two series by file type.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contains travel and study awards and subject files.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Ford Foundation maintained an office in Pakistan from 1952 to 1980. Established in Karachi in 1952, the office then moved to Islamabad in 1968. The Foundation's Pakistan program chiefly focused on supporting projects and initiatives involved with development planning and research, agriculture, education, population and family planning, and public administration. By 1980, the Foundation had issued almost $60 million in grants for Pakistan related programming (Outline for a Possible Foundation Program in Pakistan memo from Robert Shaw to John Bresnan, May 22, 1980, Ford Foundation records, Catalogued Reports, Reports 6262-9286 (FA739C), Report 009107).

In 1971, the Ford Foundation decided to suspend and cancel various program plans and reduce staff in Pakistan in response to the events of the Indo-Pakistani War, the separation of eastern and western Pakistan, and the emergence of independent Bangladesh. Program strategy focused on projects that the Foundation believed were the most likely to survive (Ford Foundation Pakistan Program Report Fiscal Year 1971, February 1, 1972, Ford Foundation records, Catalogued Reports, Reports 9287-11774 (FA739D), Report 011596). The Foundation opened an office in Bangladesh in 1972 and maintained its Pakistan office until 1980.
